summary: This is an email exchange from December 2020 regarding the Epstein investigation. A law enforcement officer requests assistance from a colleague to locate three individuals in order to serve subpoenas, providing some initial address information. The document shows active investigative efforts to subpoena persons of interest.

persons.name: Byrne, Paul
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting assistance to serve subpoenas on three persons for the Epstein investigation. Identified as a detective with the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.

events.title: Request for Subpoena Assistance
events.description: Detective Paul Byrne emails a colleague requesting assistance to locate three individuals to serve subpoenas for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Confirmation of Assistance
events.description: The recipient confirms they will work on the request to locate the three individuals for subpoena service.

keyFacts: As of December 2020, the Epstein investigation was actively pursuing subpoenas for at least three persons of interest.
The request for assistance came from a detective on the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.
One of the individuals sought had several addresses in Manhattan.
The communication strategy involved calling the individuals if a good phone number was found, otherwise sending out leads.
The document demonstrates inter-agency cooperation in locating persons for the investigation.
